original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Center Street
text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, adjoining (to the west) Center Street. The left section of this combined building is the old Vorleezer House, reputed to be the oldest known elementary school building in the United States. It also housed the first church on Staten Island. The two houses combined constituted the Arlington Hotel, owned by A. Rosenberg, according to 1898-1907 maps.

Views 1,2: P. L. Sperr

View 3: W.P.A. Photo

December 20, 1936

1936

original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Center Street
text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, at the head of, and adjoining (to the east) Center Street. The house, on the right, bearing the sign "Fairway Club", was known as the "Richmond House", owned by Otto Schaefer (1907 map).

December 20, 1936

P. L. Sperr

original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Center Street
text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, adjoining (to the west) Center Street, showing the Vorleezer House, reputed to be one of the oldest Dutch frame buildings in New York. It is believed to have been erected before 1696 and is the oldest known elementary school building in the United States and the first church on Staten Island. It was occupied by the Rezan and Van Pelt families for many years. For additional data see the New York City Guide of the Federal Writers' Project, p.612.

P. L. Sperr
February 1, 1939
